verses.plain: At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of his place.

tokens.t: At this also my heart trembleth, and is moved out of his place.

verses.plain: Hear attentively the noise of his voice, and the sound that goeth out of his mouth.

tokens.t: Hear attentively the noise of his voice, and the sound
goeth out of his mouth.

verses.plain: He directeth it under the whole heaven, and his lightning unto the ends of the earth.

tokens.t: He directeth it under the whole heaven, and his lightning unto the ends of the earth.

verses.plain: After it a voice roareth: he thundereth with the voice of his excellency; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard.

tokens.t: After it a voice roareth: he thundereth with the voice of his excellency; and he will not stay them when his voice is heard.

verses.plain: God thundereth marvellously with his voice; great things doeth he, which we cannot comprehend.

tokens.t: God thundereth marvellously with his voice; great things doeth he, which we cannot comprehend.

verses.plain: For he saith to the snow, Be thou on the earth; likewise to the small rain, and to the great rain of his strength.

tokens.t: For he saith to the snow, Be thou
the earth; likewise to the small rain, and to the great rain of his strength.

verses.plain: He sealeth up the hand of every man; that all men may know his work.

tokens.t: He sealeth up the hand of every man; that all men may know his work.

verses.plain: Then the beasts go into dens, and remain in their places.

tokens.t: Then the beasts go into dens, and remain in their places.

verses.plain: Out of the south cometh the whirlwind: and cold out of the north.

tokens.t: Out of the south cometh the whirlwind: and cold out of the north.

verses.plain: By the breath of God frost is given: and the breadth of the waters is straitened.

tokens.t: By the breath of God frost is given: and the breadth of the waters is straitened.

verses.plain: Also by watering he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth his bright cloud:

tokens.t: Also by watering he wearieth the thick cloud: he scattereth his bright cloud:

verses.plain: And it is turned round about by his counsels: that they may do whatsoever he commandeth them upon the face of the world in the earth.

tokens.t: And it is turned round about by his counsels: that they may do whatsoever he commandeth them upon the face of the world in the earth.

verses.plain: He causeth it to come, whether for correction, or for his land, or for mercy.

tokens.t: He causeth it to come, whether for correction, or for his land, or for mercy.

verses.plain: Hearken unto this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.

tokens.t: Hearken unto this, O Job: stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.

verses.plain: Dost thou know when God disposed them, and caused the light of his cloud to shine?

tokens.t: Dost thou know when God disposed them, and caused the light of his cloud to shine?

verses.plain: Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him which is perfect in knowledge?

tokens.t: Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, the wondrous works of him which is perfect in knowledge?

verses.plain: How thy garments are warm, when he quieteth the earth by the south wind?

tokens.t: How thy garments
warm, when he quieteth the earth by the south

verses.plain: Hast thou with him spread out the sky, which is strong, and as a molten looking glass?

tokens.t: Hast thou with him spread out the sky,
strong,
as a molten looking glass?

verses.plain: Teach us what we shall say unto him; for we cannot order our speech by reason of darkness.

tokens.t: Teach us what we shall say unto him;
we cannot order
by reason of darkness.

verses.plain: Shall it be told him that I speak? if a man speak, surely he shall be swallowed up.

tokens.t: Shall it be told him that I speak? if a man speak, surely he shall be swallowed up.

verses.plain: And now men see not the bright light which is in the clouds: but the wind passeth, and cleanseth them.

tokens.t: And now
see not the bright light which
in the clouds: but the wind passeth, and cleanseth them.

verses.plain: Fair weather cometh out of the north: with God is terrible majesty.

tokens.t: Fair weather cometh out of the north: with God
terrible majesty.

verses.plain: Touching the Almighty, we cannot find him out: he is excellent in power, and in judgment, and in plenty of justice: he will not afflict.

tokens.t: the Almighty, we cannot find him out:
excellent in power, and in judgment, and in plenty of justice: he will not afflict.

verses.plain: Men do therefore fear him: he respecteth not any that are wise of heart.

tokens.t: Men do therefore fear him: he respecteth not any
wise of heart.

footnotes.text: likewise…: Heb. and to the shower of rain, and to the showers of rain of his strength
his…: Heb. the cloud of his light
